quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
I am happy because I'm grateful. I choose to be grateful. That gratitude allows me to be happy.
Joy is the simplest form of gratitude.
When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.
No one who achieves success does so without the help of others. The wise and confident acknowledge this help with gratitude.
We often take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude.
Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more.
In daily life we must see that it is not happiness that makes us grateful, but gratefulness that makes us happy.
Be grateful for what you already have while you pursue your goals. If you aren’t grateful for what you already have, what makes you think you would be happy with more?
Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.
Silent gratitude isn't much use to anyone.
Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
Gratitude is riches. Complaint is poverty.
Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
Reflect upon your present blessings, of which every man has plenty.
Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance.
The root of joy is gratefulness.
Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all others.
Gratitude is the memory of the heart.
Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
Who does not thank for little will not thank for much.
Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you.
Gratitude changes the pangs of memory into a tranquil joy.
When it comes to life, the critical thing is whether you take things for granted or take them with gratitude.
Wear gratitude like a cloak, and it will feed every corner of your life.
A grateful heart is a magnet for miracles.
To speak gratitude is courteous and pleasant, to enact gratitude is generous and noble.
If the only prayer you said was thank you, that would be enough.
No duty is more urgent than returning thanks.
Gratitude is the healthiest of all human emotions.
Gratitude is the sweetest thing in a seeker's life.
The way to develop the best that is in a person is by appreciation and encouragement.
Gratitude opens the door to the power, the wisdom, the creativity of the universe.
Appreciation can make a day, even change a life.
Gratitude is when memory is stored in the heart and not in the mind.
Gratitude, according to legend, is a truffle that merely grows in the forest of the heart.
When you practice gratefulness, there is a sense of respect toward others.
The struggle ends when gratitude begins.
Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
Let gratitude be the pillow upon which you kneel to say your nightly prayer.
Gratitude is the most exquisite form of courtesy.
Gratitude is the foundation of happiness.
Let us remember that, as much has been given us, much will be expected from us.
Saying ‘thank you’ tells us we matter.
No one is useless in this world who lightens the burden of it for anyone else.
To be grateful is to recognize the love of God in everything.
The essence of all beautiful art, all great art, is gratitude.
Gratitude is a currency that we can mint for ourselves, and spend without fear of bankruptcy.
The roots of all goodness lie in the soil of appreciation for goodness.
Gratitude is the sweetest honey ever known.
Gratitude is the shortest pathway to joy.
Gratitude is an opener of locked-up blessings.
We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.
Appreciation is a wonderful thing: it makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.
Gratitude is the most divine of universal virtues.
The hardest arithmetic to master is that which enables us to count our blessings.
Gratitude is the wine for the soul.
Gratitude is a powerful catalyst for happiness.
In ordinary life, we hardly realize that we receive a great deal more than we give.
Gratitude is the best attitude.
